channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024081497
item.description:
Report X-2024081497

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: FAIRFIELD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/21/2024 at approximately 0900, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 9327095 at the Ground facility in Fairfield, reporting an undeclared dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of four (4) 1-gallon containers packaged together in one fiberboard box. The package appeared damp on its topside. Further investigation revealed the inner containers, marked to match the label on the outside of the package, identifying the commodity as Xylenes, a fully regulated dangerous goods commodity. The shipment adorned no other markings, labeling, or paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This package was found in our unload area with no markings or indicators that it contained any type of hazardous materials inside. With further investigation it was discovered that the package contained an intact cylinder tank of food grade nitrous oxide. The ISF form will be provided to show how the outer packaging was found.

item.title: Report X-2024081407
item.description:
Report X-2024081407

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-19
  • City: OXNARD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Patrick Mier CHECKER/DRIVER REG called safety to report a HazMat spill in trailer 556479 UN2692, BORON TRIBROMIDE, 8 (6.1), PG I, POISON-INHALATION HAZARD ZONE B. Patrick stated he found the 4lbs box in the nose of the trailer and stated it looked like the box was crushed by other freight in transit . Patrick stated he was not to sure if the product was still in the container in the box or if it had leaked out in the trailer. Safety advised Patrick to stay clear of the box and the trailer until a team could arrive to assist with the spill. Patrick stated the trailer was empty and the box was on e of the last of the freight on the trailer. Patrick stated he set the box down on the table outside the trailer and will send a photo to safety. Patrick stated he does not know if anything in on the trailer floor and did not feel comfortable going back in the trailer.

  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKER IN THE PRELOAD AT SPACE 1106 ON THE SLIDE USING THE DECISION TREE, THE PACKAGE WAS ON THE SLIDE UPRIGHT NO CLEAN UP. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP CAGE AND OPENED IT UP, THERE WERE 4 -1GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF CONVOTHERM CONVOCLEAN FORTE, ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP, RESPONDER PROCESED THE PACKAGE THROUGH THE DMP

item.title: Report E-2024080518
item.description:
Report E-2024080518

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 7, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum was damaged and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the top of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. GES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1719-impacted drum and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024081315
item.description:
Report X-2024081315

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-14
  • City: FRENCH CAMP
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Notification for container HGIU 513910 was releasing at the Lathrop Yard in French Camp, CA. Contractor responded and found inadequate blocking and bracing causing a load shift. One 5-gallon pail of UN1263 released 2 gallons inside the container. GrayMar Environmental (contractor) secured the load and cleaned all impacted areas. Damaged pail was overpacked and placed back in the container.

item.title: Report E-2024080488
item.description:
Report E-2024080488

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: PACOIMA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 6, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was damaged by a skid and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew containerized the damaged containers in one (1) 55-gallon drum. TWE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all impacted waste into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024080446
item.description:
Report E-2024080446

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: PACOIMA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 19, 2024, at 1415 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by XPO personnel in Pacoima, California regarding the release of Kal-Gard FA Diluted (UN1263, Paint Related Material, 3, II). Terminal personnel reported that 2 cups were released from (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to a puncture and impacted the trailer floor. Terminal personnel cleaned the release with absorbents and all waste was containerized in (1) 20-gallon DF which was staged onsite pending disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024010051
item.description:
Report I-2024010051

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T00:40:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: Los Angeles
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Fifteen minutes after departing from BOS, the customer observed their crossbody bag that they were wearing smelled strongly of the e-cigarette juice. Upon opening the zipper compartment holding the e-cigarette he saw the blue light on and was unable to switch it off. The customer immediately notified a Flight Attendant to assist with the situation. The Purser obtained the e-cigarette and utilized the fire containment bag. The crew maintained custody of the containment bag until arrival in LAX when it was tendered to the CSM who met the flight.

item.title: Report X-2024080786
item.description:
Report X-2024080786

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package came out of trailer 830928 in a wet state. Package was placed in a tote for QA. Upon inspection, contents are 4 bottles of isopropyl alcohol, with 1 bottle having a loose cap, causing its liquid contents to spill out. No protection for caps or prevention from bottles from moving was the likely cause of the cap becoming loose. Better inner packing for both bottles and caps would help prevent caps from becoming loose.

The shipment is being held for FAA investigation. 2773 8679 1655 2773 8687 4060 2773 8677 2693 2773 8695 8386 2773 8697 0056 2773 8686 7193 2773 8688 5067 2773 8682 2614 2773 8695 2002 2773 8678 6255 2773 8680 2288

item.title: Report X-2024080452
item.description:
Report X-2024080452

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: Commerce
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Notification for container EMHU 641440 was releasing at the East Yard in Commerce, CA. Contractor responded and found inadequate blocking and bracing causing a load shift. Four pails of UN3082 released 4-5 gallons outside the container and 10-12 gallons inside the container. United Pumping (contractor) secured the load and cleaned all impacted areas. Damaged pails were overpacked and placed back in the container.
